goals.question: What is the distribution of wheat prices across different regions?
goals.visualization: Box plot of wheat prices by region
goals.rationale: A box plot will show the median, quartiles, and outliers of wheat prices in each region, allowing us to compare the distribution of prices across regions.

goals.question: How does the yield of wheat vary with respect to different soil types?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of average wheat yield by soil type
goals.rationale: A bar chart will show the average yield of wheat for each soil type, allowing us to identify which soil types are most conducive to high yields.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wheat yield and rainfall?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wheat yield vs. rainfall
goals.rationale: A scatter plot will show the relationship between wheat yield and rainfall, allowing us to identify any patterns or trends in the data.

goals.question: How does the quality of wheat vary across different regions?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of wheat quality by region
goals.rationale: A stacked bar chart will show the proportion of wheat in each quality category for each region, allowing us to compare the quality of wheat across regions.

goals.question: What is the trend in wheat production over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of wheat production over time
goals.rationale: A line chart will show the trend in wheat production over time, allowing us to identify any patterns or trends in the data.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.boxplot(x='region', y='price', data=data)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of wheat prices across different regions?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(x='soil_type', y='wheat_yield', data=data, ci=None)
    plt.title('How does the yield of wheat vary with respect to different soil types?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(x='rainfall', y='wheat_yield', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wheat yield and rainfall?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(x='region', y='quality', data=data, estimator=sum, ci=None, hue='quality_category')
    ax.set_xticklabels(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, ha='right')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('How does the quality of wheat vary across different regions?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='wheat_production', data=data)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    plt.title('What is the trend in wheat production over time?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
